page.title: 01SITTINGBOURNE
page.content: Sittingbourne is an average-sized town in North East Kent.It is surrounded by the villages of Borden and Milton.The main High Street is the A2,and runs the full length of the town.The town-hall is situated in Central Avenue,just off the High Street,as are the police station,public library and post office.Also in Central Avenue is a Royal Wedding commemorative clock tower,paid for by the public.The tallest building is the Halifax Building Society in the High Street. The swimming pool,built in Victorian times,and the Fire station are in St. Michael's Road,as is the railway station.Most of the shop buildings in the High Street are Victorian and have slate roofs,and some are Georgian.The oldest building is the Red Lion pub,and still has a courtyard where stage coaches used to stop.
